plants.germinationNeeds: Propagate from 'slips' (sprouts from a mature tuber). Plant slips in mounds after the last frost when soil is warm (at least 18째C).
plants.optimalConditions: Full sun. Prefers well-drained, sandy loam. Needs a long, warm growing season of at least 5 months. Frost sensitive.

plants.germinationNeeds: Best grown from a grafted plant. Requires both male and female plants for pollination. Plant in early spring.
plants.optimalConditions: Full sun, sheltered from strong winds. Needs very well-drained, fertile soil and a sturdy support structure like a pergola or trellis. Requires regular watering.

history.notes: Need to buy male and female 'Hayward' plants.

plants.germinationNeeds: Sow seeds directly into the garden from spring to early autumn. Plant seeds 1-2cm deep in moist soil.
plants.optimalConditions: Full sun or partial shade. Tolerant of a wide range of soils but prefers fertile, well-drained soil. Hardy and productive year-round in many parts of NZ.

plants.germinationNeeds: Easily grown from purchased plants. Can be grown from seed but may not be true to type. Plant in autumn or spring.
plants.optimalConditions: Full sun. Hardy and tolerates a range of soil types, but needs good drainage. Tolerant of light frosts and some coastal exposure.

history.notes: Established well, expecting first fruit this season.

plants.germinationNeeds: Sow seeds in trays in late summer/autumn for a winter/spring harvest, or in spring for a summer/autumn harvest. Transplant when seedlings have 4-6 true leaves.
plants.optimalConditions: Full sun. Prefers fertile, well-drained soil with plenty of organic matter. A cool-season crop that can 'bolt' (flower prematurely) in hot weather.

plants.germinationNeeds: Seeds can be slow to germinate. Soak overnight before sowing. Sow directly in the garden or in pots from spring to autumn.
plants.optimalConditions: Full sun to partial shade. Prefers rich, moist, well-drained soil. Can be grown in pots or garden beds.

plants.germinationNeeds: Best grown from a purchased plant. Frost tender, so plant in a sheltered spot after all danger of frost has passed.
plants.optimalConditions: Full sun and protection from strong winds. Requires rich, fertile, well-drained soil. Needs consistent moisture.

history.notes: Find a warm, sunny, sheltered spot.

plants.germinationNeeds: Propagate from cuttings taken in spring or autumn. Can also be grown from fresh seed, though germination can be slow.
plants.optimalConditions: Native New Zealand plant. Thrives in partial to full shade in damp, rich, free-draining soil. Often found in coastal or lowland forests.

history.notes: Leaves used for tea. Heart-shaped holes are a good sign.
